DataElement.preferredDefinition: Results of the disease response timepoint assessment based on sponsor defined coded terminology.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The outcome of the disease response assessment as originally received or collected.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Disease Response Original Result Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcome of the disease response assessment as originally received or collected._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]._Clearly characterized or delimited._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms.: Some response with no new symptoms or disease and not meeting partial response.

Concepts.definition: Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms.
A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.longName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

Concepts.definition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

Concepts.definition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator.
